3 ðŸ­ ","description":"# Economy Core & NPC Factions!

> Goal: Simulate early X-style production and start the economy loop.

âœ… Deliverables:

- Add 3 major NPC factions with invisible "elevator" stations.
- Players can sell resources at these stations.

Description

Good yard fellas. This PR contains a bunch of odd jobs that have been thrown together under "cleanup". I'll list them below:
- Removed the hard limit on the length of the game screen (my bad)
- Changed the d20 functionality to roll 1-20 instead of 0-19
- Added text to the d20 pop-up so it shows the calculations for hits/misses
- Pushed down the battle footer a bit (but this will be addressed by Tinesia's future PR)
- Made the monsters and the shadows bigger (had to move Pouncing Bandit's sprite a bit lower so he wasn't floating)
- Put a border around the d20 pop-up and changed the font
- Also changed the font of the timer
- With access to Tinesia's new text component the d20 and timer font can be improved further
- Renamed the pre-existing monsters (Mystical Wyvern -> Cinder Tail, Stonehide Defender -> Rocky Rhino, Shadowfang Predator -> Pouncing Bandit)

## Type of change

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] This change requires a documentation update

# How Has This Been Tested?

Tested by playing the game and checking for the features. Also by checking console/terminal log output.

- [ ] End-to-end tests w/ Playwright
- [ ] Unit Tests
- [ ] Integration Tests
- [ ] CI Pipeline
- [x] Manual Testing (please describe if checked):
- [ ] N/A

# Checklist (only check off the applicable):

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [x] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [x] My changes generate no new warnings
- [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [x] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

Description

We have integrated battles with game sessions. Up to 8 players can now join a game session, and play battles once the host starts the game. There are still some incomplete sections of the battle (frontend for battle, monster selection, waiting screen, winning screen, match summary, further actions/abilities/monsters) that will be implemented in subsequent PR's. I think merging early is better so we can better conform to the git workflow, with PRs for bug fixes and features, etc.

## Type of change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [X] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] This change requires a documentation update

# How Has This Been Tested?

I have tested by playing battles against myself. Huu, Meng and Derek were witnesses.

- [ ] End-to-end tests w/ Playwright
- [ ] Unit Tests
- [ ] Integration Tests
- [ ] CI Pipeline
- [X] Manual Testing (please describe if checked):
- [ ] N/A

Description

- Home screen, join screen, host lobby -> functionality, routing, frontend structure implemented
- Host battles and Monster Selection pages -> used to handover for Agile Team 1
- Created queue data structure 
- Sockets implemented for Game Session room interaction
- External devices able to join sessions from local IP URL + QR Code
- Server logs will be in VSCode terminal, client logs will be in developer tools (if using Chromium)

Description

All baseline components have been made, with a number of composite components that require additional layout configuration. 
Generic cases have been made for buttons, cards, popups, images, text, progress bars and input fields. Composite components
include, custom buttons, fading text, monster selection cards, lobby forms and in game footers and headers.
